channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NC
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NC

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS REFUSED BY CUSTOMER AND TAKEN BACK TO STATION PLASED IN A PLASTIC PAIL. MOVED TO QA STAGING LOCATION DescribePack: BOTTEM OF PAIL CREAKED OPEN CONTENT LEAKED OUT DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: MOVED FROM THE QA STAGING LOCATION TO HAZNAT CAGE

item.title: Report X-2024021150
item.description:
Report X-2024021150

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found outside in a trailer laying on its side by our safety specialist Stacy Moore. Package was brought inside to the hazmat cage for inspection. During inspection it was found that the metal cap had become loose and fell off of the metal container. This caused the liquid contents to spill all throughout the plastic bag holding the metal can. Some of the contents spilled onto another hazmat, causing only the outer package to get wet. No damage was done. DescribePack: The cause of the failure was due to improper loading. The package clearly stated that this hazmat must be placed upright. This was not followed as the hazmat was found lying on its side. This caused the metal cap to come loose and liquid contents to spill throughout packaging. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a 20-gallon salvage drum to prevent further vaper and leakage.

item.title: Report E-2024020521
item.description:
Report E-2024020521

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-27
  • City: CHARLOTTE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO notified ERTS regarding one damaged carboy containing Trifluoroacetic Anhydride (UN3265). The damage was a result of improper loafing/inadequate preparation for transportation. Approximately one-gallon of product released onto the wooden trailer floor. A Contractor cleaned-up the spilled material and containerized the damaged carboy for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was unloaded off of the trailer. It was dropped from the time it came off of the trailer and brought out to the loading area. It leaked out and soiled the box it was in. DescribePack: The side of the jug where the plastic is put together at the factory. The Seam. It cracked down the side of the jug going up and down in a vertical crack. The crack is about 2 and a half inches long. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was brought around and the damaged product was taken out and put in proper container and the liquid that leaked out was soaked and cleaned up.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: TWO PACKAGES THAT WERE COLD TO THE TOUCH. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY THREE POUNDS OF DRY ICE COOLING ICE CREAM. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOXES TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. ADDITIONAL TRACKING NUMBER TO THE SAME CONSIGNEE IS 1Z02038E1320789518. THESE PACKAGES HAVE NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: CONCORD
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was brought to QA due to damage to package. 1 of 4 bottles (128 ounces each) leaked through its cap causing corrosive liquid to spill onto the other 3 bottles. and the box itself. QA cleaned up the corrosive liquid and placed package into protective bag and bin and brought to QA. DescribePack: Plastic closure under lid was not strong enough for corrosive liquid content inside, which caused the liquid to leak through the lid and onto the package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into protective plastic and hazmat safe bin

item.title: Report E-2024020472
item.description:
Report E-2024020472

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-26T15:11:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-26
  • City: CHAPEL HILL
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG ENERGY, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC driver was delivering gasoline into the customer's storage tank. During the course of the delivery, a vehicle drove through the coned off delivery area and struck the hose adaptor. The caused the connection between the hose adaptor and storage tank to become compromised and resulted in 15 gallons of gasoline being released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

item.title: Report I-2023120043
item.description:
Report I-2023120043

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T00:33:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-09
  • City: ROBERSONVILLE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ASSOCIATED PETROLEUM CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Our vehicle was traveling south on 1-95. The Town of Hope Mills, NC had attempted an arrest that led to a chase where the assailant fled to 1-95. The police continued the chase on 1-95 into a construction zone, the assailant attempted to pass our vehicle on the right where he was blocked with concrete barricades, and wedged his vehicle between our truck and the concrete barricades, causing him and our driver to crash. Our vehicle hit the concrete barricade on the right and the tank rolled over the concrete median, which gouged a small hole in two places on the tank, causing approx 1,500 gallons to spill on the roadway and soil adjacent to the road. The Fayetteville, NC hazmat team secured the area, plugged the holes, and controlled the pump out of the cargo tank, and allowed us to place absorbent booms to control the migration of the gasoline. No photos are available for the pump out and original damage due to the HazMat team keeping everyone away from the tanker until it was pumped out. The product was leaking approximately 7-8 hours until they could get the holes stopped up. We have hired a geologist to assist with supervising the follow up cleanup and removal of contaminated soil. That work has not begun at the time of this report.

item.title: Report I-2023120042
item.description:
Report I-2023120042

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-23T00:33:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-31
  • City: MILL SPRING
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ASSOCIATED PETROLEUM CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Vehicle was traveling south on NC-9. Vehicle traveled off rightside of the roadway, collided with a ditch and overturned to the left, coming to rest in the roadway on its left side. The driver immediately called and reported the incident to 911. The driver then notified his safety officer, which immediately dispatched a remediation crew. The dome lid of the #2 compartment dripped diesel fuel for approximately 5 hours (approximately 25 LGA which was contained with spill pads and boom). Advance Environmental Options, Inc mitigated the release.
